_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



The Allens Montezuma - Plant #20 facility abides by the emergency response procedures and policies outlined in the facility Emergency Response Plan manual.  This Plan was designed to meet the following objectives:

                  1) To save lives;

                  2) To minimize and avoid injuries;

                  3) To protect the environment; and

                  4) To minimize property damage.

Allens maintains an emergency response plan for the facility.  The Plan provides the response organization and notification procedures, evacuation routes, ammonia health hazard information, and accident mitigation procedures.  The procedures will be implemented to respond effectively to emergency situations which may arise at the facility, including any accidental releases of ammonia.  The facility staff recently met with LEPC personnel to conduct a table-top exercise.



Stationary Source and Regulated Substance



The Allens facility chills and stores a variety of food products in the cold and frozen storage warehouse.  The facility is chilled by a refrigeration process that uses anhydrous ammonia as the refrigerant.  The refrigeration process, consisting of compressors, evaporators, condensers, vessels, piping, valves, and instrumentation, cycles the ammonia through various physical states, from  high pressure liquid, to low pressure liquid, low pressure vapor, high pressure vapor, and then back to high pressure liquid.  These changes in the system pressure enable ammonia to absorb ambient heat and provide cooling to the food storage areas.  Typical operating conditions range from vacuum (approximately 6"Hg) on the low pressure side of the system to 160 psig on the high pressure side.  The refrigeration process holds approximately 29,500 pounds of ammonia.



Accidental Release Prevention Program



This facility operates in accordance with the International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration (II

AR) guidelines and standards, including the following:



 IIAR Bulletin 107, "Suggested Safety and Operating Procedures When Making Ammonia Refrigeration Tie-Ins"

 IIAR Bulletin 109,"Minimum Safety Criteria for a Safe Ammonia Refrigeration System"

 IIAR Bulletin 110, "Startup, Inspection, and Maintenance of Ammonia Refrigeration Systems"

 IIAR, "A Guide to Good Practices for the Operation of an Ammonia Refrigeration System."



In addition, Allens has implemented a Process Safety Management Program for compliance with OSHA's 29 CFR 1910.119, "Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals."   The program was recently reviewed and procedures were revised as needed.



Five Year Accident History



There have been no releases of ammonia in the past five years that meet the criteria for inclusion in the five-year accident history.



Emergency Response Program



The Allens Montezuma - Plant #20 Facility has an Emergency Response Program in place that is coordinated with LEPC emergency responders.
